decks.notes: The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Hooting Mandrills, along with powerful Planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns, to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes a suite of counter spells and card selection to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast tempo. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana, with cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's resources. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early and close it out with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal spells while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko and Narset. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Stifle, while also generating card advantage with Sylvan Library and Uro. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production. The deck is built to outvalue the opponent and outgrind them in a long game, utilizing a mix of control elements and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a mix of powerful planeswalkers, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. It utilizes a variety of different colored mana sources to cast its spells efficiently, while also running cards like Astrolabe to fix its mana base. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal, while generating card advantage with cards like Sylvan Library and Uro. Overall, the deck looks to maintain control of the game and grind out a win through its versatile and powerful card choices.

The main focus of this deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently using the Elves creatures and Gaea's Cradle, allowing for explosive plays and combos. The deck aims to chain together cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to draw through the deck and find key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order to close out the game in a single turn. The deck also has access to disruptive elements like Archon of Valor's Reach and Scavenging Ooze to help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on maintaining tempo and control through early aggression and disruption spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon alongside a suite of powerful cantrips and counterspells, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mana base consisting of a mix of fetchlands and dual lands, the deck can consistently cast its spells while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck's game plan revolves around quickly overwhelming the opponent while controlling the board and protecting its threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the efficient mana generation and creature abilities of Elves to quickly build up a formidable board presence. By casting spells like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to draw into combo pieces or tutor for key cards like Craterhoof Behemoth through Natural Order. The deck relies on generating large amounts of mana with cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle to overwhelm opponents with a sudden onslaught of powerful creatures and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy threats onto the battlefield, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early with versatile threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, backed up by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck also utilizes a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and Daze to keep the opponent off balance. The deck's goal is to maintain tempo and control of the game while closing out the match quickly.

This Bant Aggro deck aims to disrupt opponents with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also ramps up quickly with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Stoneforge Mystic, allowing for fast drops of powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and True-Name Nemesis. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient creatures, disruption spells, and equipment to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the match.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and utilize powerful disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect your threats. Canadian Threshold focuses on maintaining tempo and control through card advantage with cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Brainstorm, while utilizing versatile removal like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for aggressive plays with Wasteland. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It prioritizes tempo and card advantage through cards like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Oko, Thief of Crowns, alongside efficient cantrips and counterspells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze. Additionally, it aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a consistent multicolor strategy, utilizing fetch lands and dual lands in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon, while also disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Daze, Force of Negation, and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board by utilizing cheap removal spells such as Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Pyroblast. Additionally, the mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and countermagic helps to keep the opponent off balance and secure a quick victory through direct damage and evasion.

This deck aims to control the board through disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Skyclave Apparition while utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. It also focuses on flickering creatures with cards like Soulherder and Flickerwisp to generate extra value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck leverages cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Palace Jailer to further control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns to create additional threats and control the board. By utilizing cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, the deck is able to manipulate its draws and find the necessary cards to execute its game plan. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal spells in Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By controlling the board and the opponent's hand, you aim to outvalue them and protect your own win conditions. Cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help you find the cards you need while Force of Will and Force of Negation keep your opponent from resolving key spells. The inclusion of cards like The Abyss and Liliana of the Veil also provide additional tools to control the board and limit your opponent's options.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly get out powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand by using the card Show and Tell to cheat them into play. The deck also includes various cantrips and counterspells to control the game and protect the combo. Additionally, Cunning Wish is included to access a wide range of sideboard options in game one. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and win the game quickly before the opponent can respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while also using cards like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures for additional value. The deck aims to combo off by playing cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to draw through the deck and find key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth to close out the game. Using Natural Order to search for specific creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth is essential in this Elf combo strategy.
